questions.text: Choose the most appropriate statement regarding anatomy of skull

options.label: A
options.text: The anterior fontanelle (bregma) is between the frontal and temporal bones at the junction of the sagittal and coronal sutures.

options.label: B
options.text: The posterior fontanelle (Lambda) closes around the fourth month after birth.

options.label: C
options.text: The periosteum consists of two layers

options.label: D
options.text: The endosteal is the inner of the two dural layers.

questions.correct_answer: C. The periosteum consists of two layers

questions.text: A patient is unable to prevent anterior displacement of the femur on the tibia when the knee is flexed. Which of the following ligaments is most likely damaged?

questions.correct_answer: A. A. Thoracoacromial Trunk b. Cephalic vein c. Lateral Pectoral nerve

Which of the following statement regarding infection with the mumps virus is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: After initial replication, viremic spread can occur to various organs.

options.label: B
options.text: Diagnosis is made solely on symptoms, as virus cannot be cultured

options.label: C
options.text: Passive immunization is the only means of preventing infection.

questions.correct_answer: A. After initial replication, viremic spread can occur to various organs.

questions.text: Similar to rotavirus, which of the following viral agents is also a nonenveloped RNA virus known to cause gastroenteritis diarrhea in young children?
Regarding the MHC proteins and the genes that encode them, which one of the 1160 following is the most accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: The genes encoding class II MHC proteins are highly polymorphic, whereas the genes encoding class I MHC proteins are not.

options.label: B
options.text: The genes encoding class I MHC proteins are located on a different chromosome from the genes encoding class II MHC proteins.

options.label: C
options.text: The genes are codominant, and each person expresses class I and class II MHC genes inherited from both mother and father.

options.label: D
options.text: Class II MHC proteins are found on the surface of all cells, whereas class I MHC proteins are found only on the surface of phagocytes.

questions.correct_answer: C. The genes are codominant, and each person expresses class I and class II MHC genes inherited from both mother and father.

questions.text: A woman who pricked her finger while pruning some rose bushes develops a local pustule that progressed to an ulcer. Several nodules then developed along the local lymphatic drainage. The most reliable method to identify the etiologic agent is which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Culture of the organism in the laboratory

options.label: B
options.text: Gram stain of smear prepared from the lesion

questions.correct_answer: A. Culture of the organism in the laboratory

questions.text: Regarding the genes that encode antibodies, which one of the following is most accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: Hypervariable regions are encoded by the genes of both the light and heavy chains.

options.label: B
options.text: The genes for the light and heavy chains are linked on the same chromosome adjacent to the HLA locus

options.label: C
options.text: During the production of IgG, the light and the heavy chains acquire the same antigen binding sites by translocation of the same variable genes

options.label: D
options.text: The gene for the constant region of the gamma heavy chain is first in the sequence of heavy chain genes, and that is why IgG is made in greatest amounts.

questions.correct_answer: A. Hypervariable regions are encoded by the genes of both the light and heavy chains.

questions.text: Several bacteria that form spores are important human pathogens. Which one of the following is the most accurate statement about bacterial spores?

options.label: A
options.text: They are killed by boiling for 15 minutes

options.label: B
options.text: They are produced primarily by gram-negative cocci.

options.label: C
options.text: They are formed primarily when the bacterium is exposed to antibiotics.

options.label: D
options.text: They are metabolically inactive yet can survive for years in that inactive state.

questions.correct_answer: D. They are metabolically inactive yet can survive for years in that inactive state.

questions.text: Which statement is the most accurate regarding transposons?

options.label: A
options.text: They encode enzymes that degrade the ends of the bacterial chromosome

options.label: B
options.text: They are short sequences of DNA that often encode enzymes that mediate antibiotic resistance.

options.label: C
options.text: They are short sequences of RNA that silence specific regulatory genes.

options.label: D
options.text: They are a family of transfer RNAs that enhance mutations at “hot spots” in the bacterial genome.

questions.correct_answer: B. They are short sequences of DNA that often encode enzymes that mediate antibiotic resistance.

In a hospital-based study for finding the association between coffee consumption & occurrence of stroke, a group of patients hospitalized after suffering a stroke was compared to a control population hospitalized for other reasons. Patients hospitalized for stroke were found to consume significantly more coffee than the controls. All of the following statements represent possible explanations for the observed positive association between coffee consumption and stroke, EXCEPT:

options.label: A
options.text: Heavy coffee consumers may also be heavy smokers, so smoking rather than coffee drinking is the relevant causal factor

options.label: B
options.text: The patients restricted their coffee intake after suffering a stroke

options.label: C
options.text: The hospitalized controls consume less coffee, on the average, than individuals in the general population, resulting in a spurious association between coffee consumption and stroke

options.label: D
options.text: Excessive coffee consumption can cause a stroke

questions.correct_answer: B. The patients restricted their coffee intake after suffering a stroke

options.label: B

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: A. The disease is confluent, there are no skip areas in the colon and the rectum is involved

A 24-year-old woman, gravida 3, para 1, spontaneous abortions 1, presents to the emergency room reporting irregular vaginal bleeding. She is found to be pregnant and her serum hCG is 3500 mIU/mL. She has a past medical history significant for diabetes mellitus and mild asthma. Her BP = 103/68, P = 88, and T = 98.8. Transvaginal ultrasound reveals a uterus with no gestational sac present and a 2-cm right adnexal mass. The least invasive treatment of choice is:
Criteria for Severe Preeclampsia includes all except:
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Sol:
  • ↳ Criteria for Severe Preeclampsia
  • ↳ Systolic hypertension >160 mmHg Diastolic hypertension >110 mmHg Proteinuria >5 g/24 hr Oliguria <500 mL/24 hr Cerebral or visual disturbances Epigastric pain Pulmonary edema Evidence of microangiopathic hemolysis Hepatocellular dysfunction Thrombocytopenia Intrauterine growth restriction Oligohydramnios
  • ↳ Systolic hypertension >160 mmHg
  • ↳ Diastolic hypertension >110 mmHg
  • ↳ Proteinuria >5 g/24 hr
  • ↳ Oliguria <500 mL/24 hr
  • ↳ Cerebral or visual disturbances
  • ↳ Epigastric pain
  • ↳ Pulmonary edema
  • ↳ Evidence of microangiopathic hemolysis
  • ↳ Hepatocellular dysfunction
  • ↳ Thrombocytopenia
  • ↳ Intrauterine growth restriction
  • ↳ Oligohydramnios
